name: PixelFem #23 - Leola N. King
description:
Before traffic lights, there were people controlling the movement of traffic. Leola N. King was America's first female traffic controller. Here she is pictured on duty in 1918. Before this she was a teacher and briefly trained as a nurse. King was the first 'experiment' with 'traffic cops' as they were called. At the end of 1918, the chief of police was impressed, he ordered for 30 more female traffic police for the city. 

✺This work is part of PixelFems, an evolving project on the Tezos blockchain celebrating iconic women from the past and present✺
